Treatment consists of an antibiotic eye drop or ointment for 8 days. In cases resistant to treatment or in encysted forms, incision at the free edge may be necessary. This is carried out under local anaesthetic on an outpatient basis.

question.question: What is the primary treatment for a stye?
question.option_a: Applying a warm compress for 10 days
question.option_b: Using an antibiotic eye drop or ointment for 8 days
question.option_c: Performing an incision at the free edge under general anaesthetic
